title: Official Blind Review #4
review_assessment:_thoroughness_in_paper: I read the paper at least twice and used my best judgement in assessing the paper.
review:
In this paper, the authors propose a simple but effective matrix-interleaving method (mint) for multi-task learning, which aims to represent both joint training and independent training.
The model achieves good performance on several supervised and reinforced learning datasets. Though the model resembles FiLM(Perez et al., 2018), it outperforms FiLM by a larger margin in three dataset.

It would be better for authors to give more detailed comparisons with models that work on combining both joint training and independent training.

I would like to see the paper to be accepted for its simplicity and effectiveness.
